member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimLineColor
member.summary: Gets or set the color assigned to dimension lines, arrowheads, and dimension leader lines. (DIMCLRD)
member.remarks:
Default: ByBlock
Only indexed AciColors are supported.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimLineLinetype
member.summary: Gets or sets the line type of the dimension line. (DIMLTYPE)
member.remarks: Default: ByBlock

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimLineLineweight
member.summary: Gets or sets the line weight to dimension lines. (DIMLWD)
member.remarks: Default: ByBlock

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimLine1Off
member.summary: Suppresses display of the first dimension line. (DIMSD1)
member.remarks:
Default: false
To completely suppress the dimension line set both DimLine1Off and DimLine2Off to false.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimLine2Off
member.summary: Suppresses display of the second dimension line. (DIMSD2)
member.remarks:
Default: false
To completely suppress the dimension line set both DimLine1Off and DimLine2Off to false.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimLineExtend
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance the dimension line extends beyond the extension line when oblique, architectural tick, integral, or no marks are drawn for arrowheads. (DIMDLE)
member.remarks: Default: 0.0

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimBaselineSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing of the dimension lines in baseline dimensions. (DIMDLI)
member.remarks:
Default: 0.38
This value is stored only for information purposes. Base dimensions are a compound entity made of several dimensions, there is no actual DXF entity that represents that.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color assigned to extension lines, center marks, and centerlines. (DIMCLRE)
member.remarks:
Default: ByBlock
Only indexed AciColors are supported.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLine1Linetype
member.summary: Gets or sets the line type of the first extension line. (DIMLTEX1)
member.remarks: Default: ByBlock

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLine2Linetype
member.summary: Gets or sets the line type of the second extension line. (DIMLTEX2)
member.remarks: Default: ByBlock

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLineLineweight
member.summary: Gets or sets line weight of extension lines. (DIMLWE)
member.remarks: Default: ByBlock

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLine1Off
member.summary: Suppresses display of the first extension line. (DIMSE1)
member.remarks: Default: false

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLine2Off
member.summary: Suppresses display of the second extension line. (DIMSE2)
member.remarks: Default: false

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLineOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets how far extension lines are offset from origin points. (DIMEXO)
member.remarks: Default: 0.0625

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLineExtend
member.summary: Gets or sets how far to extend the extension line beyond the dimension line. (DIMEXE)
member.remarks: Default: 0.18

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLineFixed
member.summary: Enables fixed length extension lines. (DIMFXLON)
member.remarks: Default: false

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ExtLineFixedLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the total length of the extension lines starting from the dimension line toward the dimension origin. (DIMFXL)
member.remarks: Default: 1.0

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimArrow1
member.summary: Gets or sets the arrowhead block for the first end of the dimension line. (DIMBLK1)
member.remarks: Default: null. Closed filled.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimArrow2
member.summary: Gets or sets the arrowhead block for the second end of the dimension line. (DIMBLK2)
member.remarks: Default: null. Closed filled.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.LeaderArrow
member.summary: Gets or sets the arrowhead block for leaders. (DIMLDRBLK)
member.remarks: Default: null. Closed filled.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.ArrowSize
member.summary: Controls the size of dimension line and leader line arrowheads. Also controls the size of hook lines. (DIMASZ)
member.remarks: Default: 0.18

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.CenterMarkSize
member.summary: Controls the drawing of circle or arc center marks and centerlines. (DIMCEN)
member.remarks:
Default: 0.09
0 - No center marks or lines are drawn.
greater than 0 - Center marks are drawn.
lower than 0 - Center marks and centerlines are drawn.
The absolute value specifies the size of the center mark or center line. The size of the center line is the length of the center line segment that extends outside the circle or arc. It is also the size of the gap between the center mark and the start of the center line. The size of the center mark is the distance from the center of the circle or arc to the end of the center mark.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the text style of the dimension. (DIMTXTSTY)
member.remarks: Default: Standard

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextColor
member.summary: Gets or set the color of dimension text. (DIMCLRT)
member.remarks:
Default: ByBlock
Only indexed AciColors are supported.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextFillColor
member.summary: Gets or set the background color of dimension text. Set to null to specify no color. (DIMTFILLCLR)
member.remarks:
Default: null
Only indexed AciColors are supported.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of dimension text, unless the current text style has a fixed height. (DIMTXT)
member.remarks: Default: 0.18

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextHorizontalPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal positioning of dimension text. (DIMJUST)
member.remarks: Default: Centered

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextVerticalPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical position of text in relation to the dimension line. (DIMTAD)
member.remarks: Default: Centered

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance around the dimension text when the dimension line breaks to accommodate dimension text. (DIMGAP)
member.remarks:
Default: 0.09
Displays a rectangular frame around the dimension text when negative values are used.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextInsideAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets if the dimension text is placed horizontally when inside extension lines. (DIMTIH)
member.remarks: Default: false

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextOutsideAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets if the dimension text is placed horizontally when outside extension lines. (DIMTOH)
member.remarks: Default: false

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the dimension text. (DIMTXTDIRECTION)
member.remarks: Default: LeftToRight

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.TextFractionHeightScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale of fractions relative to dimension text height. (DIMTFAC)
member.remarks:
Default: 1.0
This value is only applicable to Architectural and Fractional units, and also controls the height factor applied to the tolerance text in relation with the dimension text height.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.FitDimLineForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the drawing of a dimension line between the extension lines even when the text is placed outside the extension lines. (DIMTOFL)
member.remarks: Default: false

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.FitDimLineInside
member.summary: Gets or sets the drawing of the dimension line and arrowheads even if not enough space is available inside the extension lines. (DIMSOXD)
member.remarks:
Default: true
If not enough space is available inside the extension lines and FitTextInside is true, setting FitDimLineInside to false suppresses the arrowheads. If FitDimLineInside is false, FitDimLineInside has no effect.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimScaleOverall
member.summary: Get or set the overall scale factor applied to dimensioning variables that specify sizes, distances, or offsets. (DIMSCALE)
member.remarks:
Default: 1.0
DIMSCALE does not affect measured lengths, coordinates, or angles.
DIMSCALE values of zero are not supported, any imported drawing with a zero value will set the scale to the default 1.0.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.FitOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the placement of text and arrowheads based on the space available between the extension lines. (DIMATFIT)
member.remarks:
Default: BestFit
Not implemented in the dimension drawing.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.FitTextInside
member.summary: Gets or sets the drawing of text between the extension lines. (DIMTIX)
member.remarks: Default: false

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.FitTextMove
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the text when it's moved either manually or automatically. (DIMTMOVE)
member.remarks: Default: BesideDimLine

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.AngularPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of precision places displayed in angular dimensions. (DIMADEC)
member.remarks:
Default: 0
If set to -1 angular dimensions display the number of decimal places specified by LengthPrecision. It is recommended to use values in the range 0 to 8.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.LengthPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of decimal places displayed for the primary units of a dimension. (DIMDEC)
member.remarks:
Default: 2
It is recommended to use values in the range 0 to 8.
For architectural and fractional the precision used for the minimum fraction is 1/2^LinearDecimalPlaces.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimPrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the text prefix for the dimension. (DIMPOST)
member.remarks: Default: string.Empty

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimSuffix
member.summary: Gets or sets the text suffix for the dimension. (DIMPOST)
member.remarks: Default: string.Empty

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DecimalSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets a single-character decimal separator to use when creating dimensions whose unit format is decimal. (DIMDSEP)
member.remarks: Default: "."

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimScaleLinear
member.summary: Gets or sets a scale factor for linear dimension measurements. (DIMLFAC)
member.remarks:
All linear dimension distances, including radii, diameters, and coordinates, are multiplied by DimScaleLinear before being converted to dimension text.
Positive values of DimScaleLinear are applied to dimensions in both model space and paper space; negative values are applied to paper space only.
DimScaleLinear has no effect on angular dimensions.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimLengthUnits
member.summary: Gets or sets the units for all dimension types except angular. (DIMLUNIT)
member.remarks:
Scientific
Decimal
Engineering
Architectural
Fractional

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimAngularUnits
member.summary: Gets or sets the units format for angular dimensions. (DIMAUNIT)
member.remarks:
Decimal degrees
Degrees/minutes/seconds
Gradians
Radians

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.FractionType
member.summary: Gets or sets the fraction format when DIMLUNIT is set to Architectural or Fractional. (DIMFRAC)
member.remarks:
Horizontal stacking
Diagonal stacking
Not stacked (for example, 1/2)

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.SuppressLinearLeadingZeros
member.summary: Suppresses leading zeros in linear decimal dimensions; for example, 0.5000 becomes .5000. (DIMZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMZIN variable.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.SuppressLinearTrailingZeros
member.summary: Suppresses trailing zeros in linear decimal dimensions. (DIMZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMZIN variable.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.SuppressZeroFeet
member.summary: Suppresses zero feet in architectural dimensions. (DIMZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMZIN variable.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.SuppressZeroInches
member.summary: Suppresses zero inches in architectural dimensions. (DIMZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMZIN variable.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.SuppressAngularLeadingZeros
member.summary: Suppresses leading zeros in angular decimal dimensions. (DIMZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMAZIN variable.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.SuppressAngularTrailingZeros
member.summary: Suppresses trailing zeros in angular decimal dimensions. (DIMZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMAZIN variable.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.DimRoundoff
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to round all dimensioning distances. (DIMRND)
member.remarks:
Default: 0 (no rounding off).
If DIMRND is set to 0.25, all distances round to the nearest 0.25 unit. If you set DIMRND to 1.0, all distances round to the nearest integer. Note that the number of digits edited after the decimal point depends on the precision set by DIMDEC. DIMRND does not apply to angular dimensions.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyle.AlternateUnits
member.summary: Gets or sets the alternate units format for dimensions.
member.remarks: Alternative units are not applicable for angular dimensions.

member.remarks: There is one dimension style override type for each property of the DimensionStyle class. The dimension style properties DIMBLK and DIMSAH are not available. The overrides always make use of the DIMBLK1 and DIMBLK2 setting the DIMSAH to true even when both arrow ends are the same.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerances.DisplayMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the method for calculating the tolerance. (DIMTOL)
member.remarks: Default: None

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerances.UpperLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum or upper tolerance value. When you select Symmetrical in DisplayMethod, this value is used for the tolerance. (DIMTP)
member.remarks: Default: 0.0

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerances.LowerLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum or lower tolerance value. (DIMTM)
member.remarks: Default: 0.0

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerances.VerticalPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the text vertical placement for symmetrical and deviation tolerances. (DIMTOLJ)
member.remarks: Default: Middle

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerances.Precision
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of decimal places. (DIMTDEC)
member.remarks:
Default: 4
It is recommended to use values in the range 0 to 8.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerances.SuppressLinearLeadingZeros
member.summary: Suppresses leading zeros in linear decimal tolerance units. (DIMTZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMTZIN variable.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerances.SuppressLinearTrailingZeros
member.summary: Suppresses trailing zeros in linear decimal tolerance units. (DIMTZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMTZIN variable.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerances.SuppressZeroFeet
member.summary: Suppresses zero feet in architectural tolerance units. (DIMTZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMTZIN variable.

member.summary: Suppresses zero inches in architectural tolerance units. (DIMTZIN)
member.remarks: This value is part of the DIMTZIN variable.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of decimal places of the tolerance alternate units. (DIMALTTD)
member.remarks:

member.name: T:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerancesDisplayMethod
member.summary: Defines the method for calculating the tolerance.
member.remarks: The Basic method for displaying tolerances in dimensions is not available, use a negative number for the TextOffset of the dimension style. The result is exactly the same.

member.name: F:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerancesDisplayMethod.None
member.summary: Does not add a tolerance.

member.name: F:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerancesDisplayMethod.Symmetrical
member.summary: Adds a plus/minus expression of tolerance in which a single value of variation is applied to the dimension measurement.

member.name: F:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerancesDisplayMethod.Deviation
member.summary: Adds a plus/minus tolerance expression. Different plus and minus values of variation are applied to the dimension measurement.

member.name: F:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerancesDisplayMethod.Limits
member.summary: Creates a limit dimension. A maximum and a minimum value are displayed, one over the other.

member.summary: Controls text justification for symmetrical and deviation tolerances.

member.summary: Aligns the tolerance text with the bottom of the main dimension text.

member.summary: Aligns the tolerance text with the middle of the main dimension text.

member.name: F:netDxf.Tables.DimensionStyleTolerancesVerticalPlacement.Top
member.summary: Aligns the tolerance text with the top of the main dimension text.

member.name: T:netDxf.Tables.LinetypeShapeSegment
member.summary: Represents a shape linetype segment.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.LinetypeShapeSegment.#ctor(System.String,netDxf.Tables.ShapeStyle)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LinetypeShapeSegment class.
member.param: Shape name of the linetype segment.
File where the shape of the linetype segment is defined.
member.remarks:
The shape must be defined in the .shx shape definitions file.
The DXF instead of saving the shape name, as the Shape entity or the shape linetype segments definition in a .lin file, it stores the shape number. Therefore when saving a DXF file the shape number will be obtained reading the .shp file.
It is required that the equivalent .shp file to be also present in the same folder or one of the support folders defined in the DxfDocument.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.LinetypeShapeSegment.#ctor(System.String,netDxf.Tables.ShapeStyle,System.Double)

The shape must be defined in the .shx shape definitions file.
The DXF instead of saving the shape name, as the Shape entity or the shape linetype segments definition in a .lin file, it stores the shape number. Therefore when saving a DXF file the shape number will be obtained reading the .shp file.
It is required that the equivalent .shp file to be also present in the same folder or one of the support folders defined in the DxfDocument.

The DXF instead of saving the shape name, as the Shape entity or the shape linetype segments definition in a .lin file, it stores the shape number. Therefore when saving a DXF file the shape number will be obtained reading the .shp file.
It is required that the equivalent .shp file to be also present in the same folder or one of the support folders defined in the DxfDocument.

member.summary: Gets the name of the table object.
member.remarks: Table object names are case insensitive.

member.summary: Gets if the table object is reserved and cannot be deleted.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.InvalidCharacters
member.summary: Gets the array of characters not supported as table object names.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.IsValidName(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a string is valid as a table object name.
member.returns: True if the string is valid as a table object name, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.
member.returns: The string representation.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current TableObject with another TableObject of the same type.
member.param: A TableObject to compare with this TableObject.
member.returns: An integer that indicates the relative order of the table objects being compared. The return value has the following meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This object is less than the other parameter. Zero This object is equal to other. Greater than zero This object is greater than other.
member.remarks: If both table objects are no of the same type it will return zero. The comparison is made by their names.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.CompareTo(netDxf.Tables.TableObject)
member.summary: Compares the current TableObject with another TableObject of the same type.
member.param: A TableObject to compare with this TableObject.
member.returns: An integer that indicates the relative order of the table objects being compared. The return value has the following meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This object is less than the other parameter. Zero This object is equal to other. Greater than zero This object is greater than other.
member.remarks: If both table objects are not of the same type it will return zero. The comparison is made by their names.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that is the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Check if two TableObject are equal.
member.returns: True if two TableObject are equal or false in any other case.
member.remarks: Two TableObjects are considered equals if their names are the same, regardless of their internal values. This is done this way because in a DXF two TableObjects cannot have the same name.

member.name: M:netDxf.Tables.TableObject.Equals(netDxf.Tables.TableObject)
member.summary: Check if two TableObject are equal.
member.returns: True if two TableObject are equal or false in any other case.
member.remarks: Two TableObjects are considered equals if their names are the same, regardless of their internal values. This is done this way because in a DXF two TableObjects cannot have the same name.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.TextStyle.FontFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the text style font file name.
member.remarks:
When this value is used for true type fonts should be present in the Font system folder.
When the style does not contain any information for the file the font information will be saved in the extended data when saved to a DXF, this is only applicable for true type fonts.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.TextStyle.BigFont
member.summary: Gets or sets an Asian-language Big Font file.
member.remarks: Only ACAD compiled shape SHX fonts are valid for creating Big Fonts.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.TextStyle.FontFamilyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the true type font family name.
member.remarks:
When the font family name is manually specified the file font will not be used and it will be set to empty, the font style will also we set to FontStyle.Regular. In this case the font information will be stored in the style extended data when saved to a DXF.
This value is only applicable for true type fonts.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.TextStyle.FontStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the true type font style.
member.remarks:
The font style value is ignored and will always return FontStyle.Regular when a font file has been specified.
All styles may not be available for the current font family.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.TextStyle.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the text height.
member.remarks: Fixed text height; 0 if not fixed.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.TextStyle.WidthFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the text width factor.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0.01 to 100. Default: 1.0.

member.name: P:netDxf.Tables.TextStyle.ObliqueAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the font oblique angle in degrees.
member.remarks: Valid values range from -85 to 85. Default: 0.0.

If off, FRONTZ is ignored, and the front clipping plane is set to pass through the camera point (vectors behind the camera are not displayed). This flag is ignored if the front-clipping bit (2) is off.

member.name: T:netDxf.XData
member.summary: Represents the extended data information.
member.remarks: Do not store your own data under the ACAD application registry it is used by some entities to store special data, it might be overwritten when the file is saved. Instead, create a new application registry and store your data there.

member.name: M:netDxf.XData.#ctor(netDxf.Tables.ApplicationRegistry)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the XData class .
member.param: Name of the application associated with the list of extended data records.

member.name: P:netDxf.XData.ApplicationRegistry
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application associated with the list of extended data records.

member.name: P:netDxf.XData.XDataRecord
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of extended data records.
member.remarks: This list cannot contain a XDataRecord with a XDataCode of AppReg, this code is reserved to register the name of the application. Any record with this code will be omitted.

member.name: M:netDxf.XData.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.
member.returns: The string representation.

member.name: M:netDxf.XData.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new XData that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new XData that is a copy of this instance.

member.name: T:netDxf.XDataCode
member.summary: Defines the extended data code.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.String
member.summary: Strings in extended data can be up to 255 bytes long.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.AppReg
member.summary: Application names can be up to 31 bytes long.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.ControlString
member.summary: An extended data control string can be either { or }. These braces enable applications to organize their data by subdividing the data into lists. The left brace begins a list, and the right brace terminates the most recent list. Lists can be nested.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.LayerName
member.summary: Name of the layer associated with the extended data

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.BinaryData
member.summary: Binary data is organized into variable-length chunks. The maximum length of each chunk is 127 bytes. The binary data is represented as a string of hexadecimal digits, two per binary byte.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.DatabaseHandle
member.summary: Handles of entities in the drawing database.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.RealX
member.summary: Three real values, in the order X, Y, Z. They can be used as a point or vector record. AutoCAD never alters their value.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.RealY
member.summary: Three real values, in the order X, Y, Z. They can be used as a point or vector record. AutoCAD never alters their value.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.RealZ
member.summary: Three real values, in the order X, Y, Z. They can be used as a point or vector record. AutoCAD never alters their value.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldSpacePositionX
member.summary: Unlike a simple 3D point, the world space coordinates are moved, scaled, rotated, and mirrored along with the parent entity to which the extended data belongs. The world space position is also stretched when the STRETCH command is applied to the parent entity and this point lies within the select window

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldSpacePositionY
member.summary: Unlike a simple 3D point, the world space coordinates are moved, scaled, rotated, and mirrored along with the parent entity to which the extended data belongs. The world space position is also stretched when the STRETCH command is applied to the parent entity and this point lies within the select window

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldSpacePositionZ
member.summary: Unlike a simple 3D point, the world space coordinates are moved, scaled, rotated, and mirrored along with the parent entity to which the extended data belongs. The world space position is also stretched when the STRETCH command is applied to the parent entity and this point lies within the select window

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldSpaceDisplacementX
member.summary: Also a 3D point that is scaled, rotated, and mirrored along with the parent (but is not moved or stretched)

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldSpaceDisplacementY
member.summary: Also a 3D point that is scaled, rotated, and mirrored along with the parent (but is not moved or stretched)

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldSpaceDisplacementZ
member.summary: Also a 3D point that is scaled, rotated, and mirrored along with the parent (but is not moved or stretched)

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldDirectionX
member.summary: Also a 3D point that is rotated and mirrored along with the parent (but is not moved, scaled, or stretched)

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldDirectionY
member.summary: Also a 3D point that is rotated and mirrored along with the parent (but is not moved, scaled, or stretched)

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.WorldDirectionZ
member.summary: Also a 3D point that is rotated and mirrored along with the parent (but is not moved, scaled, or stretched)

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.Real
member.summary: A real value.

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.Distance
member.summary: A real value that is scaled along with the parent entity

member.name: F:netDxf.XDataCode.ScaleFactor
member.summary: Also a real value that is scaled along with the parent. The difference between a distance and a scale factor is application-defined

member.summary: Represents an entry in the extended data of an entity.

member.name: P:netDxf.XDataRecord.OpenControlString
member.summary: An extended data control string can be either "{"or "}". These braces enable applications to organize their data by subdividing the data into lists. The left brace begins a list, and the right brace terminates the most recent list. Lists can be nested.

member.name: P:netDxf.XDataRecord.CloseControlString
member.summary: An extended data control string can be either "{" or "}". These braces enable applications to organize their data by subdividing the data into lists. The left brace begins a list, and the right brace terminates the most recent list. Lists can be nested.

member.summary: Initializes a new XDataRecord.

member.name: P:netDxf.XDataRecord.Code
member.summary: Gets the XData code.
member.remarks: The only valid values are the ones defined in the XDataCode class.

member.name: P:netDxf.XDataRecord.Value
member.summary: Gets the XData value.

member.name: M:netDxf.XDataRecord.ToString
